[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Advanced: Sybil Attack] Can an attacker create multiple malicious fullnode identities to serve poisoned transaction streams to isolate honest nodes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Monitoring: Anomaly Detection] Are there metrics to detect anomalous streaming patterns (e.g., excessive retries, version gaps)? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Monitoring: Stream Health] Can unhealthy streams (high latency, errors) be detected and switched to alternative sources? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Monitoring: Audit Logging] Are all stream requests and responses logged for forensic analysis after attacks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Dependency: Transaction Validation] Does the Transaction type from aptos.transaction.v1 have its own validation, or is it trusted blindly? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Dependency: FullnodeInfo Security] Can malicious FullnodeInfo in PingFullnodeResponse cause vulnerabilities in consuming code? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Control Flow: Early Termination] If the client closes the stream before receiving all requested transactions, does the server handle cleanup properly? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Control Flow: Pause/Resume] Is there a mechanism to pause and resume streams, and if so, can it be abused? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Control Flow: Batch Retry] If a batch fails validation, can it be retried, and could this lead to amplification attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Crypto: No Message Authentication] Without HMAC or signatures on StreamStatus/TransactionsOutput, can messages be forged? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Crypto: No Encryption] Is transaction data encrypted during transmission, or can eavesdroppers intercept sensitive transaction details? (High)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Crypto: Weak TLS Configuration] If gRPC uses TLS, are strong cipher suites enforced to prevent downgrade attacks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Static Data: FILE_DESCRIPTOR_SET] Can the embedded FILE_DESCRIPTOR_SET bytes be manipulated to cause protobuf parsing vulnerabilities? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Static Data: Descriptor Tampering] If FILE_DESCRIPTOR_SET is corrupted in memory, could this cause incorrect message parsing? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Integer Safety: Version Subtraction] When computing version differences (end - start), is checked arithmetic used to prevent panics on overflow? (High)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Integer Safety: Multiplication Overflow] In batch calculations involving multiplication (k * n), can overflow silently wrap around? (High)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Integer Safety: Casting u64 to usize] On 32-bit systems, can u64 version numbers be safely cast to usize for indexing? (Medium)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Compliance: gRPC Metadata] Can malicious gRPC metadata headers be used to inject commands or bypass authentication? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Compliance: Stream Bidirectionality] Is GetTransactionsFromNode truly server-streaming only, or can clients send data mid-stream? (Low)
[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Compliance: Message Order] Does gRPC guarantee in-order delivery of stream messages, or can reordering occur? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Performance: Slow Read Attack] Can a client read data very slowly to keep streams open indefinitely, exhausting server resources? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Performance: Rapid Reconnection] Can an attacker rapidly open and close streams to cause resource churn and CPU exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Performance: Large Version Gaps] Can requesting transactions with huge gaps in version numbers cause inefficient database queries? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Rust: Clippy Warnings] The allow(clippy::derive_partial_eq_without_eq) suggests PartialEq without Eq - can this cause semantic issues in collections? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/protos/rust/src/pb/aptos.internal.fullnode.v1.rs] [Rust: Clone Performance] With repeated Clone on large TransactionsOutput.transactions vectors, can memory/performance issues arise? (Low)
